The high number of DETs for 1 and 3 dpe (> 8000), contrasts with a previous study of intestinal regeneration in A. japonicus where less than 4000 DETs were found
23 . Notwithstanding, these differences can be attributed to the significance criteria established for each study. In A. japonicus, an adjusted p-value of < 0.001 was established as threshold for significance, while our study used a value of < 0.05. In fact, using the same significance criteria (see Supplementary Fig. S2 online), the number of DETs is similar (3587) to those reported in the A. japonicus study. Our results are also comparable with a study done in E. fraudatrix applying equivalent significance benchmarks (adjusted p-value < 0.05) documenting 17,227 DETs in regenerating intestine relative to intact gut
24 .
